discussion.content: I'll be honest, if i encounter these question on the exam im raising hell lol

Question should be "idle scan" to get the answer as zombie.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idle_scan
It should be C, idle means PC not in use

questions.question_text: An "idle" system is also referred to as what?

choices.A: PC not connected to the Internet

choices.B: The longer a disk is in use, the less likely it is that deleted files will be overwritten
choices.D: Secure delete programs work by completely overwriting the file in one go
choices.A: When files are deleted, the data is overwritten and the cluster marked as available
choices.C: While booting, the machine may create temporary files that can delete evidence

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct. The problem with D is the "in one go". Not all the programs works like that
Should not D be also valid?

comments.content: This comment is correct... secure wipe programs go over the harddisk multiple times, which is why D is incorrect.
I think C is correct, D can be correct but they said "in one go" and it's not entirely true (some programs overwrite 2 or 3 times with 0 or 1 to avoid any recovery)

questions.question_text: In the context of file deletion process, which of the following statement holds true?

discussion.content: I do not understand the response. Antonela deos?

questions.question_text: John and Hillary works at the same department in the company. John wants to find out Hillary's network password so he can take a look at her documents on the file server. He enables Lophtcrack program to sniffing mode. John sends Hillary an email with a link to Error! Reference source not found. What information will he be able to gather from this?

choices.D: The network shares that Hillary has permissions
choices.B: The SID of Hillary network account
choices.A: Hillary network username and password hash
choices.C: The SAM file from Hillary computer

comments.content:
LOOK CLOSELY! its not BGP its written as BPG which is NOTHING! 
its a trick question lol
EC-Council loves to trick like this

discussion.content: Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) is a layer 2 protocol as well for networks. Typically found in carrier and ISP networks but I'd give preference to OSPF of course.

questions.question_text: Kimberly is studying to be an IT security analyst at a vocational school in her town. The school offers many different programming as well as networking languages. What networking protocol language should she learn that routers utilize?
What is the target host IP in the following command?

choices.C: Firewalk does not scan target hosts
choices.D: This command is using FIN packets, which cannot scan target hosts
